description: Discover how your banana peels and vegetable scraps can transform into nature's most powerful plant food! This episode breaks down the art of composting into simple, actionable steps anyone can follow.Learn why chemical fertilizers might be doing more harm than good, and how switching to homemade compost can revolutionize your garden's health. We explore the fascinating process of turning everyday kitchen waste into nutrient-rich soil that your plants will love.The discussion extends beyond just gardening, touching on how sustainable practices like composting contribute to a healthier environment and potentially even your wallet. Karthik shares valuable insights connecting these eco-friendly habits to broader business and financial wisdom.Ready to start your composting journey and join the movement towards sustainable gardening? Listen to this episode to unlock the secrets of creating your own "black gold" while contributing to a greener planet.ðŸŽ§ Press play now to transform your kitchen waste into gardening success!Please get to know meThanks for reading! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work. To hear more, visit karthikeyathallapally.substack.com
html_description:
Discover how your banana peels and vegetable scraps can transform into nature's most powerful plant food! This episode breaks down the art of composting into simple, actionable steps anyone can follow.

Learn why chemical fertilizers might be doing more harm than good, and how switching to homemade compost can revolutionize your garden's health. We explore the fascinating process of turning everyday kitchen waste into nutrient-rich soil that your plants will love.

The discussion extends beyond just gardening, touching on how sustainable practices like composting contribute to a healthier environment and potentially even your wallet. Karthik shares valuable insights connecting these eco-friendly habits to broader business and financial wisdom.

Ready to start your composting journey and join the movement towards sustainable gardening? Listen to this episode to unlock the secrets of creating your own "black gold" while contributing to a greener planet.

ðŸŽ§ Press play now to transform your kitchen waste into gardening success!

Please get to know me

Thanks for reading! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.



To hear more, visit karthikeyathallapally.substack.com
name: Composting for a Greener Tomorrow: Simple Steps to Nourishing Your Garden

show.description: The business world is full of overnight success stories and get-rich-quick schemes. This isn't that podcast. Welcome to Reality Check with Karthik, where we cut through the entrepreneurial BS and talk about what building a business looks like. I'm Karthik Thallapally, founder of a marketing agency and Global Sustainable Initiative, who's helped 50+ entrepreneurs grow their businesses. But here's the thingâ€”I'm still figuring it out too. And that's exactly why this podcast exists. What you'll get:  Real talk about the mistakes I'm making (so you don't have to) Honest breakdowns of business, finance, and sustainable growth No-fluff strategies that actually work for beginners The truth about entrepreneurship that no one talks about  Perfect for: Aspiring entrepreneurs and early-stage founders who are tired of highlight reels and want the real story. Each episode is 5-10 minutes of pure valueâ€”because your time matters, and fluff doesn't. Ready to stop chasing fantasies and start building something real? Hit subscribe and let's navigate this journey together. New episodes every Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday at 8:30 PM. Real insights, real struggles, real growth. karthikeyathallapally.substack.com

The business world is full of overnight success stories and get-rich-quick schemes. This isn't that podcast.
Welcome to Reality Check with Karthik, where we cut through the entrepreneurial BS and talk about what building a business looks like.
I'm Karthik Thallapally, founder of a marketing agency and Global Sustainable Initiative, who's helped 50+ entrepreneurs grow their businesses. But here's the thingâ€”I'm still figuring it out too. And that's exactly why this podcast exists.
